Description: LootNFT.io uses non-fungible tokens (NFTs) for auctions of virtual art.

Use case: Issue fan crypto tokens by football clubs as additional financing and governance
Description: PSG as well as other clubs (e.g. AC Milan) are issuing cryptocurrency tokens that increase in value as the team's popularity increases. As an example, Lionel Messi's acquisition by PSG was partially paid in crypto tokens. Tokens also provide some voting rights to fans for minor decisions.

Use case: Enable trading of art, collectibles, through NFT marketplaces
Description: The largest NFT marketplaces are about art and collectibles[i] and use Ethereum. The most prominent are OpenSea, Axie Infinity (headquartered in Vietnam, and deals with online games), NBA Top Shot (US basketball). Decentraland, a virtual world referenced elsewhere in this document, also has an NFT marketplace to support transactions. NFTs are now traded on Coinbase, Binance and other exchanges.

Use case: Use decentralized autonomous organizations to support artists
Description: These entities unite contributors around certain assets, or collectibles. NFTs are a common choice. NFT Curators (Collectors band together to pool both their capital and their collections, and with the resulting liquidity, they can support artists in new ways). While the accumulation of NFTs may also yield extremely favorable financial returns, these communities often have no intention of selling their items, at least in the short-to-medium term. The acquisition of NFTs and other collectibles also has a fundamentally different tenor — involvement is as much, or more, about fandom and affinity as it is about alpha. These groups often take on the role of curators for certain projects, too, adding a kind of institutional longevity and support. SquiggleDAO, for example, exists to support and collect generative art, while MeebitsDAO collects Meebits NFTs. PleasrDAO acts as an “art collecting empire” across projects. NounsDAO is the gathering point for holders of Noun NFTs, who receive a share in future Noun sales. Source: The Generalist

Use case: Enable a WiFi network through blockchain
Description: Blockchain based Helium.com enables a crowdsourced WiFi network, where users add software to their router and use Helium's cryptocurrency as an incentive and governance mechanism.

Use case: Use eSports and Multiplayer video games to attract millions
Description: Better network connectivity and faster processors have led to the emergence of massive global networks of players, part of them becoming professionals and influencers who tap into actual and lucrative markets. League of Legends is an example. The dynamics of the games, including novel strategies, are integral part of the entertainment, the training of the respective AI, and the future development of the games

Use case: Use decentralized autonomous organizations to produce media
Description: Forefront, Bankless, and DarkStar are Media DAOs. These entities produce public content, often collaboratively. Rewards from that content are shared across the group, while governance is also a communal affair. Stakeholders may help decide on topics to cover as well as managing resourcing. (Source: The Generalist)

Use case: Use decentralized autonomous organizations to support artists
Description: Creator DAOs center themselves around an individual. Just like some fan clubs give an influencer’s most passionate supporters opportunities for consumption and interaction, DAOs have the capacity to do the same. Beyond pure fandom, stakeholders can also actively contribute or work for an organization that supports the creators for whom they are most enthusiastic. A number of creators adopt “social tokens” through products like Roll, which lay the groundwork for true Creator DAOs. Early movers include Leaving Records and Personal Corner.(Source: The Generalist)

Use case: Use decentralized autonomous organizations to produce media
Description: PubDAO creates and promotes media articles related to crypto, through a blockchain-based DAO (decentralized autonomous organization). They describe themselves as "a decentralized Associated Press". News are debated initially in a Discord channel, but PubDAO is expected to use extensively a $PUB token to decide of allocation of resources.

Use case: Allocate free accommodation to the needy
Description: Airbnb.org's mission is to partner with their community to offer housing in emergencies, from natural disasters to COVID-19. It was for instance used to match supply and demand of accommodation in the aftermath of Ukraine's war refugees surge in Europe.
